channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @jh_swanson @RavMABAY And with no social media pushback!
@SamuelSpinner @ShulimLeifer Vulgar, visual, yet surprisingly non-violent. What’s not to love? Also, the direct English translation is a tongue twister, unlike the original.
@PhillipsPOBrien @6502_ftw https://t.co/eldiWabDO8

Yiddshist friends: Is this a breakthrough moment for the most famous Yiddish vulgarism? https://t.co/YFyFvHVNwH
And is America ready to adopt a three-word Yiddish phrase?
@atrubek Surely not as crowded as the space of the Holocaust novels and Boomer memoirs that fill my submissions inbox.
Gotta love the publishing industry’s need for comparable titles for a book that targets a whole new demographic. https://t.co/4WUKgbHx0P

Important life advice that I just forwarded to my kids. https://t.co/bRwLmYxO4V
Don’t allege a crime if you can’t do the time, as it were.
@BerryFLW @Sandwichman_eh @froomkin If a significant minority of advertisers and readers support that perspective, you can bet the Times will both sides it. Cf their recent piece on crypto.
@GOnyeneho @Tzipshmil @froomkin Happened to Google MLK’s Letter from a Birmingham Jail just now. The Times declined to publish it.

@EladNehorai @froomkin Better to be dependent and draw a salary than independent and unemployed.
@EladNehorai @froomkin As I’ve said, the Times has the relationship to White America that Jewish papers have to the Jewish community. As long as a decent proportion of white machers are Republican despite it all, the Times will treat the Republican as serious people acting in good faith despite it all.
TIL that the @nytimes declined to publish Dr. King's "Letter from a Birmingham Jail" with its critique of "moderates." https://t.co/jYgq4X7aQ3
@drskyskull That’s one way to make a 30 Under 30 list.
@Popehat What about those of us who considers ourselves New Yorkers but live on the Hudson’s West Bank?
Tell me you, as a foreign immigrant, don’t understand American Constitutional governance without…. https://t.co/MwmkUup0xN

Important read for American Jews, and directly relevant to the article I’m writing for this week’s @JewishStandard. https://t.co/6FTly4S18B
White Jews could still be discriminated against socially while benefiting from political white supremacy that gave them real advantages over Black people.
“We’re in a toxic environment when attacks on the presidency are seen as a way to get traction on [expletive deleted] media,” scoffs @dick_nixon. https://t.co/gY3m8jD9IH
@onthemainline @eddyportnoy Certainly organized Holocaust denial played a role. But I’m also wondering about 70s confessional culture.
@onthemainline @eddyportnoy Interesting. Which means the willingness of H survivors to begin talking in their later years was as much a result of cultural forces as of their own distance.

@onthemainline @eddyportnoy I also think it must reflect how the women told their story to their children and neighbors and relatives. The scandal made the papers at the time but not the family memory a generation later.
@HeerJeet @amlamey Definitely the most frightening subject line in my inbox today.
@ParkerMolloy @swordsjew Methinks he didn’t want to release the texts.
@eddyportnoy So is Israel going to supply them with Waze, if not means?
@venetianblonde @bobdylan New recordings? Or new disks from old masters?
@zackamenetz Is there anything more Meta?

@EricJGreenberg1 @YKleinHalevi @elonmusk Eric, Yossi: We might consider that Israel is happy to align with a dictatorial USA like it has aligned like dictators elsewhere before.
@EricJGreenberg1 @YKleinHalevi @elonmusk And of course, if things get bad enough here my daughter who just got her teudat zehut might be joined by her siblings. So that would be an Israeli win-win.
